statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Jason Terry scored 19 points and Nazr Mohammed had two big plays down the stretch as the Atlanta Hawks stopped a
six-game losing streak with a 95-91 victory Monday over the Houston Rockets.
article.headline: Abdur-Rahim, Thomas ejected for fighting
article.linkText: Win-lose: Hawks end slide; Abdur-Rahim tossed for fighting
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- Shareef Abdur-Rahim wasn't around to see the end of the game, but the message he left his teammates was good enough. Jason Terry scored 19 points and the Atlanta Hawks overcame Abdur-Rahim's ejection to stop a six-game losing streak with a 95-91 victory Monday over the Houston Rockets. Nazr Mohammed finished with 18 points and 17 rebounds and made two big plays down the stretch. He blocked Steve Francis' tying layup in the final minute, then tipped in Terry's miss to give Atlanta a four-point lead on the next possession. The Hawks held on from there. Atlanta had lost its past five at home but salvaged the final game of a five-game homestand. Abdur-Rahim and Houston's Kenny Thomas were ejected late in the third quarter after their battle for position in the lane escalated into a fight. Both threw punches before being separated along the baseline. "It was unfortunate they got in a fight," Mohammed said. "But we had to continue to fight hard like he did. He fought hard trying to get us this win." Abdur-Rahim, who seconds earlier had been given a technical for arguing with referee Ron Garretson, had 16 points and nine rebounds. Thomas had 11 points. It was the first ejection for Abdur-Rahim since March 3, 2001, against the Lakers; Thomas was last ejected April, 10, 2000, against Utah. "It definitely sparked a lot of intensity," Terry said of the fight. "We had to be a lot more aggressive to match their intensity. Rough play caused us to come out, and it was a challenge." Cuttino Mobley had 26 points for the Rockets, who've lost four of five. Steve Francis had 25 points, 10 assists and nine rebounds. He missed two of Houston's previous five games because of migraine headaches but played the entire 48 minutes Monday. The Rockets are 12-10 with Francis in the lineup, 1-18 without him. The Rockets took a nine-point lead early in the second quarter on a 3-pointer by Moochie Norris. Atlanta slowly climbed back in it and scored the first six points of the third to tie it at 45. The rest of the game featured four more ties and nine lead changes. "I thought we had a great defensive first half," Houston coach Rudy Tomjanovich said. "We just couldn't make shots." Mohammed's averaging 18.8 points and 17 rebounds in his past four games, all double-doubles. He's shooting 59 percent during that stretch, and was 8-of-10 against Houston. "I'm the garbage man," he said. "If I get a pick and roll, and they give it to me, I'm happy. If they cut to the basket and give it to me, I'm happy. If not, I just have to go get it off the rim."

Game notes
Francis is the only player leading his team in scoring, rebounding and assists. No Houston player has ever led the team in all three in the same season. ... Referee Blane Reichelt gave Atlanta guard Jacque Vaughn just his second career technical shortly after the fight. Vaughn was called for a foul after stealing the ball, and held the ball out toward Reichelt. It appeared Vaughn didn't say a word before Reichelt issued the technical.
